definition:
Let $X$ and $P$ be modules. We say that $P$ is a [*projective cover*]{}
of $X$ if $P$ is a projective module and there exists an epimorphism
$p \colon P \to X$ such that $\operatorname{ker} p$ is a superfluous
submodule of $P$.

Equivalently, $P$ is an projective cover of $X$ if $P$ is projective,
and there is an epimorphism $p \colon P \to X$, and if
$g \colon P' \to X$ is an epimorphism from a projective module $P'$ to
$X$, then there exists an epimorphism $h \colon P' \to P$ such that
$ph = g$. $$\xymatrix{
  &
  P'
        \ar[d]^g
        \ar@{-->}[dl]_h
  \\
  P
        \ar[r]_p
  &
  X
        \ar[r]
        \ar[d]
  &
  0
  \\
  &
  0
}$$
